title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and natural numbers $$m$$ and $$n$$, such that $$m>n$$, the quotient rule of exponents states that $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$
speech: For any real number a and natural numbers  m  and  n , such that  m is greater than n , the quotient rule of exponents states that  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to, a raised to the m minus n power

, such that   m is greater than n

title: Quotient Rule of Exponents
text: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression: $$\frac{-3x^5}{x^5}=-3x^{5-5}=-3x^0$$
speech: Use the quotient rule to simplify the expression:  fraction, negative 3 x to the fifth, over, x to the fifth,  is equal to, negative 3, x raised to the 5 minus 5 power is equal to, negative 3 x to the 0

title: Zero Exponent Rule
text: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that $$a^0=1$$
speech: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that , a to the 0 is equal to 1
pacedSpeech: For any nonzero real number a, the zero exponent rule of exponents states that  , a to the 0 is equal to 1

title: Simplify
text: Use the Zero Exponent Rule to simplify the expression: $$-3x^0=-3(1)$$
speech: Use the Zero Exponent Rule to simplify the expression:  minus 3 x to the 0 is equal to, negative 3 times 1
